Igor Ranitovic writes:
> Is there any easy way for you to check for any hard drive failures? This might be a long shot but 
> possibly it could save us some time if turns out that Frontier hit a bad block...

The disk checks out just fine.

I just ran with assertions turned on as Gordon suggested, and as he
expected an assertion fired, the following being an example:

java.lang.AssertionError
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.KeyedQueue.wake(KeyedQueue.java:192)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.Frontier.wakeReadyQueues(Frontier.java:753)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.Frontier.next(Frontier.java:464)
        at org.archive.crawler.frontier.Frontier.next(Frontier.java:564)
        at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:134)
 
I've attached the compressed log file here: it's 5.5K compresed, <100K
uncompressed. If the list strips the attachment I'll send under
separate cover to Michael.

    -tree


--8CC6zOQ2VS
